DOC.brief_summary: Prospective, randomized multicenter study to determine the safety and effectiveness of performing corneal collagen cross-linking (CXL) using riboflavin and UVA light in eyes with ectasia after refractive surgery.
DOC.detailed_description: Subjects are randomized to a control group or a treatment group, with the control group crossed over to the treatment group at the 3 month visit. Corneal collagen cross-linking is performed as a single treatment. Subjects are followed for 12 months after the procedure to evaluate the long term effects of corneal collagen cross-linking.
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of ectasia after refractive surgery Documented ectasia on Pentacam or topography map BSCVA worse than 20/20 Must complete all study visits History of delayed wound healing History of corneal melt or corneal dystrophy
